sentences.sentence: “One day, however, I got word that he was dying.
I hurried at once to the garden, mad that he should slip out of my clutches( 控制 ) like that, and, looking through the window, I saw him lying in his bed, with his sons on each side of him.
I’d have come through and taken my chance( 碰运气 ) with the three of them, only even as I looked at him his jaw dropped, and I knew that he was gone.
I got into his room that same night, though, and I searched his papers to see if there was any record of where he had hidden our jewels.
There was not a line, however, so I came away, bitter and savage as a man could be.
Before I left I had the thought that if I ever met my Sikh friends again it would be a satisfaction to know that I had left some mark of our hatred:
so I scrawled down the sign of the four of us, as it had been on the chart, and I pinned it on his chest.
It was too much that he should be taken to the grave( 坟墓 ) without some token( 纪念品 ) from the men whom he had robbed and cheated.
We earned a living( 谋生 ) at this time by my exhibiting poor Tonga at fairs and other such places as the black cannibal( 食人族 ).
He would eat raw meat and dance his war-dance, so we always had a hatful( 一帽所装的量 ) of pennies after a day’s work.
I still heard all the news from Pondicherry Lodge, and for some years there was no news to hear, except that they were hunting for the treasure.
At last, however, came what we had waited for so long.
The treasure had been found. It was up at the top of the house, in Mr. Bartholomew Sholto’s chemical laboratory.
I came at once and had a look at the place, but I could not see how with my wooden leg I was to make my way up to it.
I learned, however, about a trap door( 通气门 ) in the roof, and also about Mr. Sholto’s supper-hour.
It seemed to me that I could manage the thing easily through Tonga.
I brought him out with me with a long rope wound round his waist.
He could climb like a cat, and he soon made his way through the roof, but, as ill luck would have it, Bartholomew Sholto was still in the room, to his cost.
Tonga thought he had done something very clever in killing him, for when I came up by the rope I found him marching about as proud as a peacock( 孔雀 ).
He was so surprised when I started whipping( 鞭打 ) and cursing( 咒骂 ) him.

I took the treasure-box and let it down, and then slid down myself, having first left the sign of the four upon the table, to show that the jewels had come back at last to those who had most right to them.
Tonga then pulled up the rope, closed the window, and made off the way that he had come.
I don’t know that I have anything else to tell you.
I had heard a sailor speak of the speed of Smith’s launch( 汽艇 ) the Aurora, so I thought she would be a useful boat for our escape.
I made an agreement with old Smith, and was to give him a big sum if he got us safe to our ship.
He knew, no doubt, that all was not strictly legitimate( 合法的 ), but he was not in our secrets.
All this is the truth, and if I tell it to you, gentlemen, it is not to amuse you—for you have not done me a very good turn( 为我做好事 )—
but it is because I believe the best defense( 辩护 ) I can make is just to hold back( 隐瞒 ) nothing,
but let all the world know how badly I have myself been treated by Major Sholto, and how innocent I am of the death of his son.”
“A very remarkable account,” said Sherlock Holmes. “A fitting end to an extremely interesting case.
There is nothing at all new to me in the latter part of your narrative( 叙述 ), except that you brought your own rope. That I did not know.
By the way, I had hoped that Tonga had lost all his darts( 刺 ); yet he managed to shoot one at us in the boat.”
“He had lost them all, sir, except the one which was in his blow-pipe( 吹箭筒 ) at the time.”
“Ah, of course,” said Holmes. “I had not thought of that.”
“Is there any other point which you would like to ask about?” asked the convict( 囚犯 ), in a friendly manner.
“I think not, thank you,” my companion answered.
“Well, Holmes,” said Athelney Jones, “duty is duty, and I shall feel more at ease when we have our storyteller here safe under lock and key( 在押 ).
The cab still waits, and there are two inspectors downstairs.
I am much obliged to you both for( 因...对你们表示感谢 ) your assistance. Of course you will be wanted at the trial. Good night to you.”
“Good night, gentlemen both,” said Jonathan Small.
“Well, and there is the end of our little drama( 戏剧性事件 ),” I remarked, after we had set some time smoking in silence.
“I fear that it may be the last investigation( 调查 ) in which I shall have the chance of studying your methods. Miss Morstan has done me the honor of( 赏光 ) accepting me as her future husband.”
He gave a most dismal( 沮丧的 ) groan( 叹息声 ).
“I feared as much,” said he. “I really cannot congratulate you.”
I was a little hurt.
“Have you any reason to be dissatisfied with my choice?” I asked.
“Not at all. I think she is one of the most charming young ladies I ever met, and might have been most useful in such work as we have been doing.

But love is an emotional( 情绪化的 ) thing, and whatever is emotional( 情绪化的 ) is opposed to( 与...对立 ) that true cold reason which I place above all things. I should never marry myself, lest( 以免 ) I bias( 使有偏见 ) my judgment.”
“I trust,” said I, laughing, “that my judgment may survive the ordeal( 严酷考验 ). But you look weary( 疲惫的 ).”
“Yes, the reaction is already upon me. I shall be as limp( 无力的 ) as a rag for a week.

By the way, Jones told me they had a confederate( 同伙 ) in the house—none other than Lal Rao, the servant; so Jones actually has the undivided honor of having caught one fish in his great haul( 一网鱼 ).”
“The division seems rather unfair,” I remarked. “You have done all the work in this business. I get a wife out of it, Jones gets the credit, what remains for you?”
“For me,” said Sherlock Holmes, “there is always the next case.”

article_info.previous: 军人在赌博中总是输因而欠下了很多债务，Jonathan抓住了这个机会向Morstan上尉和Sholto少校寻求合作的机会，最终由Sholto少校带着图纸去印度寻找宝藏，结果他却私吞了宝藏不再回来。一次偶然的机会Jonathan救了一个当地的岛民Tonga，并在Tonga的帮助下终于成功逃脱，开始了自己的复仇之路。
article_info.share_words: “You have done all the work in this business. I get a wife out of it, Jones gets the credit, what remains for you?”“For me,” said Sherlock Holmes, “there is always the next case.”

question.cn: 当时Jonathan是如何维持生计的？
question.en: How did Jonathan earn a living at that time?

options.en: By stealing money from strangers.

options.cn: 通过在集市和类似的场所展览Tonga。
options.en: By exhibiting Tonga at fairs and other such places.
By taking a part-time job.

analysis: 文中提到：“We earned a living at this time by my exhibiting poor Tonga at fairs and other such places as the black cannibal. He would eat raw meat and dance his war-dance, so we always had a hatful of pennies after a day’s work. ”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 当他们进入了Bartholomew的房间，出现了什么计划之外的情况呢？
question.en: What happened beyond their plan when they got into Bartholomew’s room?

options.en: Mr. Bartholomew was still in the room.
The treasure box had been removed.

options.cn: Mr. Bartholomew出去了但是Mr. Thaddeus在那儿。
options.en: Mr. Bartholomew was out but Mr. Thaddeus was there.

analysis: 文中提到：“He could climb like a cat, and he soon made his way through the roof, but, as ill luck would have it, Bartholomew Sholto was still in the room, to his cost. ”因此答案选A。

question.cn: Mr. Smith对于Jonathan的所有事都知情吗？
question.en: Did Mr. Smith understand the whole business of Jonathan?

options.en: Yes, he did.
No, he didn’t.
Not mentioned.

analysis: 文中提到：“I made an agreement with old Smith, and was to give him a big sum if he got us safe to our ship. He knew, no doubt, that all was not strictly legitimate, but he was not in our secrets.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 为什么在丢失了他的毒刺之后Tonga还能够射击呢？
question.en: Why did Tonga manage to shoot after losing his thorns?

options.cn: 因为他还有另外一袋刺。
options.en: Because he had another bag of thorns.

options.cn: 因为他用了其他东西替代。
options.en: Because he used something else instead.

options.cn: 因为吹箭筒里还有一根刺。
options.en: Because he still had one in his blow-pipe.

analysis: 文中提到：“He had lost them all, sir, except the one which was in his blow-pipe at the time.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: Holmes对待婚姻的态度是怎样？
question.en: What was Holmes’ attitude toward marriage?

options.en: He was eager to marry.
He would not marry.

options.cn: 他从来没认真思考过这个问题。
options.en: He had never thought about it seriously.

analysis: 文中提到：“But love is an emotional thing, and whatever is emotional is opposed to that true cold reason which I place above all things. I should never marry myself, lest I bias my judgment.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: Holmes对什么感到厌烦？
question.en: What was Holmes tired of?

options.en: The idleness of life.
Endless work.
The constant pain.

analysis: 文中Holmes说道：“My mind hates boredom above everything. Give me problems on which to use my skills of observation and deduction. I hate the dullness of one day just following another. ”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 促使Miss Morstan来找Holmes的直接原因是什么？
question.en: What was the direct reason that Miss Morstan came to Holmes?

options.cn: 她没有和往常一样收到珍珠。
options.en: She didn’t receive a pearl as usual.
She received a strange letter.

options.cn: 她在回家路上被陌生人尾随。
options.en: She was followed by a stranger on her way home.

analysis: 文中Miss Morstan说道：“Yes, just today. That is why I have come to you. This morning I received this letter, which you will perhaps read for yourself.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 是谁写的这封奇怪的信？
question.en: Who wrote the strange letter?

options.en: Miss Morstan’s father.
The wooden-legged man.

options.cn: 跟每年寄珍珠的是同一个人。
options.en: The same person who sent the pearl every year.

analysis: 文中Holmes对比了神秘来信和以前的盒子上的笔迹后发现：“They are disguised hands, except the letter, but there can be no question as to the authorship.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: Thaddeus的静居所看起来怎样？
question.en: What did Thaddeus’ little retreat look like?

options.en: It was badly lit and worse furnished.

options.cn: 它充满了东方华贵情调。
options.en: It was full of the atmosphere of Eastern luxury.
It was furnished with fake paintings.

analysis: 文中写道：“In that dismal house, it looked as out of place as a perfect diamond in a setting of brass. . . The two great tiger-skins on the floor, and the sweet smell of incense that filled the air, added to the atmosphere of Eastern luxury. ”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 根据Thaddeus所说，Morstan上尉是怎么死的？
question.en: According to Thaddeus’s story, how did Captain Morstan die?

options.cn: 他是被Sholto少校殴打致死的。
options.en: He was beaten to death by Major Sholto.

options.cn: 他是在争吵时心脏病发作死掉的。
options.en: He died from a heart attack at the moment of a quarrel.
He was poisoned by the servant.

analysis: 文中写道：“He had suffered for years from a weak heart, but he hid it from every one. I alone knew it. . . Morstan had sprung out of his chair in anger, when he suddenly pressed his hand to his side, his face turned dark, and he fell backwards, cutting his head against the corner of the treasure-chest. When I stooped over him I found, to my horror, that he was dead.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 是谁在Sholto少校死后第一个发现了宝藏？
question.en: Who was the first to discover the treasure after Major Sholto’s death?

options.en: Mr. Bartholomew.
The Indian servant.
Mr. Thaddeus.

analysis: 文中提到：“Bartholomew is a clever fellow. . . He knocked a hole, therefore, in the lath-and-plaster ceiling of the highest room, and there, sure enough, he came upon another little attic above it, which had been sealed up and was known to no one. In the center stood the treasure-chest, resting upon two rafters. He lowered it through the hole, and there it lies.”因此答案选A。

question.cn: Mr. Bartholomew是被发现死在哪儿的？
question.en: Where was Mr. Bartholomew found dead?

options.en: In the attic.
On the roof.
In his bedroom.

analysis: 文中提到：“Together we flung ourselves upon it once more, and this time it broke with a sudden snap, and we found ourselves within Bartholomew Sholto’s bedroom. It looked like a chemical laboratory. ”因此答案选C。

question.cn: Mr. Bartholomew是怎么死的？
question.en: How did Mr. Bartholomew die?

options.en: He was beaten to death by someone.
He was killed by a poisoned thorn.

options.cn: 他死于一场化学实验事故。
options.en: He died from an accident in chemical experiment.

analysis: 文中提到：“‘Ah, I expected it. Look here!’He pointed to what looked like a long, dark thorn stuck in the skin just above the ear.‘It is a thorn. You may pick it out. But be careful, for it is poisoned.’”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 是什么使得这桩案件变得不再寻常？
question.en: What was it that lifted the case from the regions of the commonplace?

options.en: The mysterious ally.
The wooden-legged man.
The treasure.

analysis: 文中Holmes说道：“There are features of interest about this ally. He lifts the case from the regions of the commonplace.I fancy that this ally breaks fresh ground in the history of crime in this country—though there are similar cases from India and from Africa.”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 对这起案件，Jones和Holmes一开始的看法一致吗？
question.en: Did the Jones and Holmes share the same opinion on the case at first?

options.en: Yes, they did.
No, they didn’t.
We don’t know.

analysis: 文中Jones说：“Just facts here, no room for theories.”以及后来逮捕Thaddeus时Holmes说他会证明Thaddeus的清白，因此答案选B。

question.cn: 根据Holmes的说法，以下有关Jonathan Small的表述正确的是？
question.en: According to Holmes, which of the following statements is CORRECT about Jonathan Small?

options.cn: 他年轻且受过良好的教育。
options.en: He was young and well educated.
He was an intelligent child.
He wore a wooden stump.

analysis: 文中提到：“His name, I have every reason to believe, is Jonathan Small. He is a poorly-educated man, small, active, with his right leg missing, and wearing a wooden stump which is worn away upon the inner side. His left boot has a coarse, square-toed sole, with an iron band round the heel. ”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 除了大小，阁楼里这些脚印还有什么值得注意的地方？
question.en: What was worth noting about the footmarks in the attic apart from their size?

options.cn: 跟Holmes的脚一样，所有脚趾都挤在一起。
options.en: All toes were squeezed together like that of Holmes’s.
Each toe was distinctly divided.

options.cn: 它们的数量跟其它脚印差不多。
options.en: They appear to be much as other footmarks.

analysis: 文中提到：“Your toes are all squeezed together. The other print has each toe distinctly divided.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 屋子里Jonathan Small的盟友是谁？
question.en: Who was an ally of Jonathan Small inside the house?

options.en: The Indian servant Lal Rao.
The housekeeper Mrs. Bernstone.
The porter McMurdo.

analysis: 文中提到：“He found out where Sholto lived, and very possibly he established communications with someone inside the house. There is this servant, Lal Rao, whom we have not seen. Mrs. Bernstone has told me that she does not trust him. ”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 罪犯是如何逃跑了的？
question.en: How did the criminals escape?

options.en: They went away in a steam launch.

options.cn: 他们乘坐大型载货船离开了。
options.en: They went away in a big barge.
They went away in a cab.

analysis: 文中提到：“Sir, it is in the steam launch that he has gone. That’s what puzzles me, for I know there aren’t enough coals in her to take her further than Woolwich. If he’d been away in the barge I’d have thought nothing of it, for many a time a job has taken him as far as Gravesend, and then if there was much to do there he might have stayed over. ”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 对于Morstan上尉的失踪，Sholto少校作何反应？
question.en: How did Major Sholto respond to Captain Morstan’s disappearance?

options.en: He said nothing about that.

options.cn: 他厌恶两个儿子谈论这件事。
options.en: He hated it when his sons talked about that.

options.cn: 他过去常常和儿子们一起讨论这件事。
options.en: He used to join his sons’ discussions about that.

analysis: 文中提到：“We read the details in the papers, and, knowing that he had been a friend of our father’s, we discussed the case freely in his presence. He used to join in our discussions as to what could have happened. ”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 为什么Mr. Athelney来到了Holmes的公寓？
question.en: Why did Mr. Athelney come to Holmes’ apartment?

options.cn: 因为他需要帮助，并且他收到了一封来自Holmes的电报。
options.en: Because he needed help and he had received a telegram from Holmes.
Because he wanted to arrest Holmes and Watson.

options.cn: 因为他想要在Holmes和Watson面前炫耀。
options.en: Because he wanted to show off before Holmes and Watson.

analysis: 文中Athelney说道：“My professional reputation is at stake, and I should be very glad of a little assistance. . . I had a telegram from him this morning, by which I understand that he has got some clue to this Sholto business.”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 罪犯把他们的汽艇藏在了哪里？
question.en: Where did the criminals hide their launch?

options.en: At a wharf.
In a repairer’s yard.
On an island.

analysis: 文中Holmes分析道：“I wondered what I should do myself if I were in his shoes. I could only think of one way of doing it. I might hand the launch over to some boat-builder or repairer, with directions to make a small repair to her. She would then be removed to his shed or yard, and so be effectively hidden, while at the same time being available at a few hours’ notice.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 最后那个野蛮人怎么样了？
question.en: What happened to the savage in the end?

options.en: He was caught by the police.
He was shot and killed.
He managed to escape.

analysis: 文中提到：“Our guns rang out together. He whirled round and fell sideways into the white swirl of the waters. ”以及后来又说道：“On our return we flashed our searchlight in every direction, but there was no sign of the Islander. Somewhere in the dark mud at the bottom of the Thames lie the bones of that strange visitor to our shores.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 为什么Jonathan Small没有扔下整个箱子呢？
question.en: Why hadn’t Jonathan just thrown the whole box?

options.cn: 因为他没有想到这一点。
options.en: Because he hadn’t thought about that.

options.cn: 因为这样会更便于他们找回宝藏。
options.en: Because that would make it easier for them to recover.

options.cn: 因为他想要自己收藏那个箱子。
options.en: Because he wanted to keep the box himself.

analysis: 文中Jonathan说道：“Easier for me to throw, and easier for you to recover. The man that was clever enough to hunt me down is clever enough to pick an iron box from the bottom of a river. Now that they are scattered over five miles or so, it may be a harder job.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: Jonathan是如何与Tonga结识的？
question.en: How did Jonathan meet Tonga?

options.en: Tonga and Jonathan had a fight in the woods.
Jonathan met Tonga while traveling on the sea.

options.cn: Tonga病得很重，然后Jonathan治愈了他。
options.en: Tonga was seriously ill and Jonathan got him cured.

analysis: 文中提到：“One day when Dr. Somerton was down with a fever, a little Andaman Islander was picked up by some prisoners in the woods. He was sick to death, and had gone to a lonely place to die. I took him in, and after a couple of months I got him cured and able to walk. ”因此答案选C。

share_title: 100天读完4本英文书，今天是第45天
